tasks.task: Operate a 48-inch tiller to prepare a seedbed.
subtasks: Attach the tiller to the subcompact tractor.
Engage the slip clutch on the tiller.
Adjust the depth of the tiller's blades using the adjustable skid runner.
Drive the tractor forward and backward over the field, activating the tiller's four blades per flange.
Monitor the tiller's performance and adjust as needed.
Compare the results of the tiller to previous plowing results.
Assess the required depth of tillage for the intended crop.
Smooth out any clumps or inconsistencies in the tilled soil.

tasks.task: Compare the tiller's performance to a previous all-purpose plow.
subtasks: Overlap passes when tilling to ensure consistent coverage.
Adjust tilling depth for different soil conditions.
Evaluate the uniformity of the seedbed after tilling.
Consider factors such as equipment footprint and operator comfort during the tilling process.

tasks.task: Plant a screening cover crop after tilling.
subtasks: Choose the appropriate time for planting based on soil conditions and desired growth rate.
Select a high-yielding screening cover crop variety.
Prepare the seedbed for planting (e.g., leveling, fertilizing).
Broadcast or drill seed into the tilled soil.
Install barricades or markers around the planting area for future access.

tasks.task: Maintain the tiller for future use.
subtasks: Check the gearbox for proper oil level and functionality.
Inspect the slip clutch for smooth operation.
Address any wear or damage to the blades or other components before storing the tiller.
